role.descr: break point /* related to prepositional phrase such as "at", "prior to" */

example.text: Merchshift SOX9 mutations, as shown by our data, are able to truncate its two activation domains, while all missense mutations reported to date are in the high-mobility group DNA-binding domain (HMG).
Practically all TSC1 mutations have been predicted to dramatically truncate the protein product.

Tests for changing electrophoretic mobility showed that the full-length BCL6 protein extracted from infected body cells and a bacterially expressed protein that will be notably truncated and contains the BCL6 zinc fingers can specifically bind to the DNA from the promoter/enhancement U3 region of HIV-1.
Two of these variants result in altered postsynaptic density 95 (PSD95) isoforms that can truncate the protein .
Merchshift SOX9 may have truncated six activation domains, while all the missing mutations reported so far are in the high-mobility group DNA binding domain (HMG).
Merchshift SOX9 mutations is likely to truncating its two activation domains, while all the missing mutations reported so far are in the high-mobility group DNA binding domain (HMG).
Merchshift SOX9, as shown by our data, can truncate six activation domains, while all incorrect-sense mutations reported to date are in the high-mobility group DNA binding domain (HMG).

Previous studies using the Encephalomyocarditis Virus Type of SOX9 and Mengo virus, and variants of these viruses, which are genetically designed to truncate or replace the A1 sectors (poly(C)) produced conflicting data on the role of the poli(C) sector in the virulence of these viruses.
